Design of an Intelligent Greenhouse Control System Based on LoRa
(Chinese-to-English Translation)

HUO Chunguang; LIU Ying; DAI Wei
Project

Abstract

Implementing large-scale environmental control for agricultural greenhouses using modern information technologies is a key development direction for China’s agriculture. In this paper, we design a LoRa- and cloud-platform-based greenhouse environment control system. The system collects indoor temperature and humidity data via LoRa sensor nodes, transmits it to a gateway, and then uploads it to the cloud platform over GPRS. Administrators can monitor and remotely adjust all environmental parameters in real time through a web interface or directly via the gateway. If any parameter deviates from set thresholds, the system sends an alert SMS to administrators and automatically takes corrective actions. To handle power outages, a power-failure memory function is included: in the event of sudden power loss, all data are preserved, and upon restoration, the system automatically resumes operation, ensuring safe environmental conditions. Experiments demonstrate that the proposed system eliminates errors inherent in manual monitoring and, through remote automated control, allows users to adjust greenhouse conditions in real time from anywhere—significantly improving crop quality and operational efficiency.
